docs.text: Background and Introduction I am a well-presented and highly motivated individual who enjoys analysing and solving business challenges using a blended combination of both financial accounting awareness and advanced IT skills in the most efficient manner. My background in external audit has allowed me to apply a rigorous scientific method approach to data analysis projects within businesses, ensuring transparency at all times. I passionately believe in the convergence of business processes, data analytics, mobile employees and platform agnostism to bring major improvements and efficiencies to both pre-existing and new problems. My current role allows me to pursue all of the above with the freedom and scope to innovate as necessary. ACCA qualified in 2008 I scored the highest mark globally in Paper 8 Implementing Audit Procedures. Previous awards for work within the UK include multiple TICE-E business unit role model awards, including the performance on a working capital project and an award for knowledge sharing across lines of service within PricewaterhouseCoopers. I have a strong team ethos, and work well with senior management, partners and stakeholders. I feel that my major strength is my ability to think laterally when faced with a problem, determining the most commercially efficient and cost-effective method of solving it using the tools available. Colleagues have found it re-assuring to have someone with my finance background and commercial awareness explain technical matters in plain English whilst still being able to challenge subject matter experts acting as consultants where appropriate. I'm as comfortable writing Python code to deploy onto a RaspberryPi as I am presenting to a Board of Directors. Key Skills Soft Busines Analysis Presentation Skills Change Leadership and Vision Strategy Technical and Interests Chartered Accountant (Fellow, ACCA) SQL, Python, R, .NET, Go Linux Kubernetes, containers and Infrastructure as Code Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, particularly productionisation as a scalable service linked to the above Blockchain Digital Twins and Reality Capture Employment History Balfour Beatty Plc Director of IT Strategy & Data | 2018 - Present Balfour Beatty’s Director of IT Strategy and the architect of their automated project reporting system - Project on a Page (PoaP); the underlying Data Lake; and Data Strategy. With my previous role as Group Head of Financial Planning & Analysis, and earlier experience at PricewaterhouseCoopers, I bring high level business insight and acumen to drive a data-driven approach to construction. Responsible for the Group’s overall strategy in relation to Technology and Data, incorporating: System Design; Integration; Reporting and Master Data Management. This encompasses holistic analysis and exploitation of data and the application of technology within the organisation in order to drive business process improvements. The role requires close working with the Business and Senior Stakeholders, identifying requirements and opportunities to provide: efficiency in operations; effectiveness in decision making; and meaningful insight. Some of the critical areas of responsibility include: Enterprise Architecture and system design / integration; Master Data Management, setting standards and governance requirements; and Business Process Optimisation and re-design as necessary in order to facilitate data standards and capture as well as automate management information, actions and decisions from the resulting insight. Previous Roles Group Head of Financial Planning and Analysis | Nov 2015 – Apr 2017 Senior Group Analytics Manager | Jan 2015 – Nov 2015 Group Analytics Manager | May 2014 – Jan 2015 PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP Manager | Sep 2004 – Dec 2011 Clients Pearson Group British Telecom Rio Tinto State of Victoria Government British Gas Exxon Mobil Camelot Group Eastman Kodak Key Experience Senior Associate in charge of the Group audit team, with responsibilities including group consolidation, functional currency, treasury (application of IAS 32 and 39 across a portfolio of derivatives and bonds including fair value and net investment hedging). Telecom “technical advisor” to engagement with oversight responsibility for network current cost accounting, and Network Charge Controls (NCCs) surrounding the regulation of interconnection prices (the prices that BT charges other telecoms companies for using its network). Team member in September 2007 for the working capital report issued in preparation for the $38bn acquisition of Alcan. Responsible for auditing assumptions in the working capital model for the following areas: revenue; EBITDA; aluminium; copper; iron ore; and coal. In 2008 responsible for the design, management and delivery of an initial scoping report to the client for the two year proposed project. The objective of the assignment was to assist VicTrack in bringing it’s accounts in line with prescribed accounting standards by applying fair value measurement to fixed assets, including the assessment of depreciated current cost. The assets in question were the entire rail infrastructure for the State of Victoria in Australia. In 2009 worked on the £4bn floatation of Barrick Gold's African operations, including 2 week placement in both Dar es Salaam and the Buzwagi goldmine on the Congo border. In 2010 was asked to re-design PwC UK's procedures. Joined Process and Optimisation team and was Architect and project manager of new UK-wide external confirmations process for the Global Assurance Delivery Model In 2011 promoted to Manager grade.
